tit.e: Otsu-e (Otsu paintings, named after the town of Otsu in Shiga Prefecture)
Otsu-e (Otsu paintings, named after the town of Otsu in Shiga Prefecture)
Otsu-e (Otsu paintings, named after the town of Otsu in Shiga Prefecture)

sen.j: クリーブランド美術館所蔵。
sen.e: In the collection of The Cleveland Museum of Art.
In a collection at The Cleveland Museum of Art.
In a collection at The Cleveland Museum of Art.

sen.j: 大津絵（おおつ-え）とは、滋賀県大津市で江戸時代初期から名産としてきた民俗学絵画である。
sen.e: Otsu-e is a national painting for which Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture, has been noted from the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Otsu-e is a style of painting and local specialty for which Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture, has been noted for from the early Edo period.
Otsu-e is a style of painting and local specialty which Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture, has been noted for from the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: for which のforを削除（後出のため）

sen.j: さまざまな画題を扱っており、東海道五十三次を旅する旅人たちの間の土産物・護符として知られていた。
sen.e: The subject of a painting varied, and among those who traveled Tokaido Gojusan-tsugi (fifty-three stages in Tokai-do Road) the painting was known as a souvenir or a charm.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The subject of these paintings varied, and among those who traveled Tokaido Gojusan-tsugi (fifty-three stages in Tokai-do Road) the paintings were known as a souvenier or a charm.
The subject of these paintings varied, and among those who traveled Tokaido Gojusan-tsugi (53 stages in Tokai-do Road) the paintings were known as a souvenier or a charm.

sen.j: 大津絵の画題を唄い込んだ元唄・音曲・俗曲（大津絵節）、大津絵節を元に踊る日本舞踊の一種（大津絵踊り）にも、「大津絵」の名がついている。
sen.e: The name of 'Otsu-e' is given to the original song, ongyoku (a popular old-style Japanese song accompanied by samisen music), and a folk song (Otsu-e bushi) into which the subject of Otsu-e was put, and also given to a kind of classical Japanese dancing based on Otsu-e bushi (Otsu-e dancing).
sen.cmt: 「元唄」」の意味が未詳のため、字面どおり「original song」と訳出しました。
sen.e: The name of 'Otsu-e' is also used to refer to the original song, ongyoku (a popular old-style Japanese song accompanied by shamisen music), a folk song (Otsu-e bushi) which shares the subject of Otsu-e, and also a kind of classical Japanese dance based on Otsu-e bushi (Otsu-e dancing).

The name of 'Otsu-e' is also used to refer to the original song, ongyoku (a popular old-style Japanese song accompanied by shamisen music), a folk song (Otsu-e bushi) which shares the subject of Otsu-e, and also a kind of classical Japanese dance based on Otsu-e bushi (Otsu-e dancing).

sen.j: 東海道五十三次、逢坂関の西側に位置する近江国追分駅 (滋賀県)（髭茶屋追分）を発祥の地とする。
sen.e: The birthplace of Otsu-e is Oiwake Station (Higechaya-oiwake (Higashichaya bisection)) in Omi Province (Shiga Prefecture), which was to the west of Osaka no seki (the Osaka Barrier), Tokaido Gojusan-tsugi.

The birthplace of Otsu-e is Oiwake Station (Higechaya-oiwake (Higashichaya bisection)) in Omi Province (Shiga Prefecture), which was to the west of Osaka no seki (the Osaka Barrier), Tokaido Gojusan-tsugi.

The birthplace of Otsu-e is Oiwake Station (Higechaya-oiwake [Higashichaya bisection]) in Omi Province (Shiga Prefecture), which was to the west of Osaka no seki (the Osaka Barrier), Tokaido Gojusan-tsugi.
sen.cmt: 括弧内の括弧を[]に変更

sen.j: 寛永年間（1624年- 1644年）のころに仏画として描かれ始めた。
sen.e: During the Kanei era (1624-1644), it began to be painted as a Buddhist painting.
During the Kanei era (1624-1644), Otsu-e began to be painted as Buddhist paintings.
During the Kanei era (1624-1644), Otsu-e began to be painted as Buddhist paintings.

sen.j: 当初は信仰の一環として描かれたものであったが、やがて世俗画へと転じ、加えて18世紀ごろより教訓的・風刺的な道歌を伴うようになった。
sen.e: At first it was painted as one part of expressing his or her faith, but before long it was transformed into a secular painting, and then since the 18th century, it came to be accompanied with an educational and satirical didactic poem

At first they were painted as a form of expressing one's faith, but before long they transformed into secular paintings, and since the 18th century, they came to be accompanied with educational and satirical didactic poems.

At first they were painted as a form of expressing one's faith, but before long they transformed into secular paintings, and since the 18th century, they came to be accompanied with educational and satirical didactic poems.

sen.j: 松尾芭蕉の俳句「大津絵の筆のはじめは何佛」には、仏画が多かった初期の大津絵の特徴が表れている。
sen.e: The early characteristics of Otsue which contained many Buddhist paintings are well expressed in the haiku by Basho MATSUO, 'Various kinds of Buddha are drawn in Otsu-e, so which one will the painter draw in the New Year.'
sen.cmt: 大津絵には様々な仏が描かれるが、正月の筆始めには、画工たちは何仏を描くのだろう。
sen.e: The early characteristics of Otsue which contained many Buddhist paintings are well expressed in the haiku by Basho MATSUO, 'Various kinds of Buddha are drawn in Otsu-e, so which one will the painter draw in the New Year.'

The early characteristics of Otsue which contained many Buddhist paintings are well expressed in the haiku by Basho MATSUO, 'Various kinds of Buddha are drawn in Otsu-e, so which one will the painter draw in the New Year.'

sen.j: また、江戸時代初期のキリシタン弾圧に際して「自分は仏教である」という蓑関連事象的役割も有していたと言われる。
sen.e: Also, it is said that when a crackdown on Christian was conducted in the early Edo period, the Otsu-e was used as a perfect guise of saying that 'I am a Buddhist.'
Also, it is said that during the oppression of Christianity during the early Edo period, the Otsu-e were used as a perfect guise to say that 'I am a Buddhist.'
Also, it is said that during the oppression of Christianity during the early Edo period, the Otsu-e were used as a perfect guise to say that 'I am a Buddhist.'

sen.j: 江戸時代を通じ、東海道大津宿の名物となった。
sen.e: Throughout the Edo period, it had been the feature of Otsu-juku Station on the Tokaido road.
Throughout the Edo period, they had been the specialty of Otsu-juku Station on the Tokaido road.
Throughout the Edo period, they had been the specialty of Otsu-juku Station on the Tokaido road.

sen.j: 文化 (元号)・文政期（1804年- 1829年）には「大津絵十種」と呼ばれる代表的画題が確定し、一方でお守りとしての効能も唱えられるようになった（「藤娘」は良縁、「鬼の寒念仏」は子供の夜泣き、「雷神姿かたち」は雷除けなど）。
sen.e: During the eras of Bunka and Bunsei (1804-1829), the representative subjects of Otsu-e painting called 'Ten kinds of Otsu-e' were decided, meanwhile its effectiveness as a charm came to be advocated. ('Fujimusume' (wisteria maiden)) is effective for a good match, 'Ogre's reciting Buddhist invocations in midwinter' is for babies' night crying, and 'raijin (the god of thunder) sugata katachi (form)' is against being struck by lightning, etc.)
sen.cmt: 「藤娘大津絵の藤娘」は、ウェブを参照したところ、「藤娘」と表記されており、「大津絵の藤娘」はリンク先の語であったため、訳出してません。
sen.e: During the eras of Bunka and Bunsei (1804-1829), the representative subjects of Otsu-e painting called 'Ten kinds of Otsu-e' were decided, meanwhile its effectiveness as a charm came to be advocated. ('Fujimusume' (wisteria maiden)) is effective for helping find a good match, 'Ogre's reciting Buddhist invocations in midwinter' is to help babies crying at night, and 'raijin (the god of thunder) sugata katachi (form)' will prevent being struck by lightning, etc.)

During the eras of Bunka and Bunsei (1804-1829), the representative subjects of Otsu-e painting called 'Ten kinds of Otsu-e' were decided, meanwhile its effectiveness as a charm came to be advocated; ('Fujimusume' (wisteria maiden) is effective for helping find a good match, 'Ogre's reciting Buddhist invocations in midwinter' is to help babies crying at night, and 'raijin (the god of thunder) sugata katachi (form)' will prevent being struck by lightning, etc.)
sen.cmt: 文中のピリオドをセミコロンとし、一文にしました。翻訳者コメントどおり、原文からも削除しました。Maiden)) の括弧一つ削除

sen.j: 画題は増え続け、幕末には最盛期を迎えた。
sen.e: The subject of a painting kept increasing, and it reached the peak at the end of Edo Period.
The subjects of the paintings continued to increase, and reached its peak at the end of the Edo Period.
The subjects of the paintings continued to increase, and reached its peak at the end of the Edo Period.

sen.j: しかし、画題の簡略化に伴って減少し、現在では百余種とされる。
sen.e: However, accompanied with the simplification of the subject, it has been decreasing, and now it is said that there are over 100 kinds of subjects.
However, with the simplification of the subjects, there has been a decline, and now it is said that there are over 100 kinds of subjects.
However, with the simplification of the subjects, there has been a decline, and now it is said that there are over 100 kinds of subjects.

sen.j: 神仏や人物、動物がユーモラスなタッチで描かれ、道歌が添えられている。
sen.e: The gods, Buddha, people, and animals are painted humorously, and a didactic poem is added.
The gods, Buddha, people, and animals are painted humorously, and a didactic poem is added.
The gods, Buddha, people, and animals are painted humorously, and a didactic poem is added.

sen.j: 多くの絵画・道歌には、人間関係や社会に関する教訓が風刺を込めて表されている。
sen.e: In many paintings and didactic poems, human relationships and the teachings in society are expressed satirically.
In many paintings and didactic poems, human relationships and the teachings of society are expressed satirically.
In many paintings and didactic poems, human relationships and the teachings of society are expressed satirically.

sen.j: ※の付いているものは「大津絵十種」と呼ばれる主要画題。
sen.e: * is attached to the main subjects called 'Ten kinds of Otsu-e.'
* This is attached to the main subjects called 'Ten kinds of Otsu-e.'
* This is attached to the main subjects called '10 kinds of Otsu-e.'

sen.j: 他項に記述あるものはこれを明記する。
sen.e: A subject which has a reference is noted.
Subjects that have references are noted.
Subjects that have references are noted.

sen.j: 地震を起こす大鯰をニホンザルがヒョウタンを用いて押さえ込もうとしている滑稽画。
sen.e: A humorous painting in which a Japanese monkey tries to pin down a big catfish that causes an earthquake with a bottle gourd.
A humorous painting in which a Japanese monkey tries to use a gourd to pin down a giant catfish which is causing an earthquake.
A humorous painting in which a Japanese monkey tries to use a gourd to pin down a giant catfish which is causing an earthquake.
